The report predicts that society will have emitted enough carbon dioxide by early 2028.

articles.title: Swiss heatwaves getting more extreme
articles.author: Swissinfo
articles.summary: Temperatures in Switzerland have risen at a faster pace in the last 50 years. Since 1971, the average annual temperature in Switzerland has risen by 2.6 degrees. Heatwaves in Switzerland are warming more than the average temperature, according to MeteoSwiss.

articles.title: SC Aquarium program enables Lowcountry residents to help track sea level rise. Here's how.
articles.author: File/Tony Kukulich/Staff
articles.summary: The SeaRise Citizen Project was created by the South Carolina Aquarium in 2023. It allows anyone with a mobile device to turn flood photos into flood data. Beaufort County will install seven signs to raise awareness of the initiative. There are currently about 39 signs around Charleston County.

articles.title: 12 States, 43 Local Governments At High Risk Of Flood Disaster In 2025
articles.summary: 12 states and 43 LGAs have been identified as high-risk areas for flooding in 2025. 5,264,097 people were affected by flooding across Nigeria in 2024. The 2024 incident resulted in the loss of 1237 lives and widespread destruction across 35 states. NEMA established a five-member technical committee to work on flood disaster management.

articles.title: Greta's Mutiny on the Bounty
articles.author: Kendal Hemphill
articles.summary: Greta Thunberg left Italy on a boat called the Madleen with less than a truckload of food and an awful lot of gall on 1 June. They were going to break Israel's 17-year blockade of the Gaza Strip. Israel has been careful about who, and what weapons, they allow to be brought into Gaza since 2007, when Hamas terrorist group took control.
